text.__SUMMARY__: Brachystomia eulimoides is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The milk-white or yellowish white shell is rather solid, nearly opaque, somewhat glossy.Its length measures 5 mm.  It is marked by microscopic spiral striae. The  six to seven whorls of the teleoconch are somewhat convex, and rapidly enlarging. The suture is moderate, distinct. The umbilical chink is very narrow or is lacking. The columellar tooth is strong.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
Azores Exclusive Economic Zone
British Isles
Dorset
European waters (ERMS scope)
Goote Bank
Greek Exclusive Economic Zone
Irish Exclusive economic Zone
Portuguese Exclusive Economic Zone
Spanish Exclusive Economic Zone
United Kingdom Exclusive Economic Zone
text.Notes:
Additional information regarding this species:
Habitat: Known from the nearshore.
text.References:
Kantor Yu.I. & Sysoev A.V. (2006) Marine and brackish water Gastropoda of Russia and adjacent countries: an illustrated catalogue. Moscow: KMK Scientific Press. 372 pp. + 140 pls
